name: flamboyancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very confident in your behaviour, and liking to be noticed by other people, for example because of the way you dress or talk: The performer was known for his flamboyancy and especially his brightly-coloured jumpsuits. It takes a lot of courage to dress with the flamboyancy that she does in this very conservative town.
More examplesFewer examplesAge did not diminish the flamboyancy that had characterized the early years of her career. He was a charismatic and skilful player, known for his flamboyancy both on and off the pitch.
